sentences.sContent: As an engineer, I liked the look of the lasso idea and bought one.
sentences.sContent_eng: As an engineer, I liked the look of the lasso idea and bought one.
sentences.sCn: 作为一名工程师，我非常喜欢这个套索的创意和外形，所以立刻就买了一个。

sentences.sContent: Where the Marlboro Man juggled cigarettes with a coiled lasso or a horse, Mr Landers tended to kick about in New England snow.
sentences.sContent_eng: Where the Marlboro Man juggled cigarettes with a coiled lasso or a horse, Mr Landers tended to kick about in New England snow.
sentences.sCn: 在万宝路男人用一条盘绕的套索或一匹马耍弄香烟之处，兰德斯先生则往往是在新英格兰的雪中游荡。

trans.tranOther: a rope with one end tied in a circle, used to catch cattle and horses, especially in the western US
